info.game_comments: (Drew Barrymore: Hi, I'm Drew Barrymore, and you can see me when my movie Music and Lyrics opens on Valentine's Day.  But now, sit back, and see how you do with answering my clues today on Jeopardy!)

double_jeopardy_round: IN THE MIDDLE OF THE STATE

(1, 1).clue: God tells him his project will be fifty cubits in breadth & thirty cubits high

(3, 1).clue: This brand of grape juice was created in 1869 & was billed as unfermented wine

(4, 1).clue: The Dodecanese Islands of this nation include Karpathos, Kos & Rhodes

(5, 1).clue: These were certainly "a girl's best friend" for notorious British jewel thief Joan Hannington

(6, 1).clue: In December 1776 Thomas Paine began "The Crisis", a series of this 8-letter type of publication

(1, 2).clue: In Exodus 2:10 a woman "called his name" this: "and she said, because I drew him out of the water"

(3, 2).clue: That's Dorothy Hope Smith's unfinished sketch of a neighbor's baby on the labels of this brand

(4, 2).clue: Little dots of nothing called the Shag Rocks lie about 700 miles east of these islands, subject of a 1980s conflict

(5, 2).clue: The USA's first of these robberies, netting $245,000, was on Wall Street in 1831

(6, 2).clue: A Denver or western one of these includes minced onions, minced green peppers & diced ham

(1, 3).clue: In Revelation 18 earth bewails this mighty city's destruction (gardens & all, we assume)

(2, 3).clue: "Greetings, Great Affection For Thee Wells Up Within Me"

(3, 3).clue: The sight of a balloon-filled sky filled a baking company VP with a sense of this, hence the name of their bread

(4, 3).clue: At about 43,000 square miles, it's the largest independent island nation in the western hemisphere

(5, 3).clue: Gunned down himself in 1957, Albert Anastasia had the Gilbert & Sullivan-inspired title "Lord High" this

(6, 3).clue: Jonathan Livingston could tell you it's the throat or the esophagus

(1, 4).clue: Belshazzar sees the handwriting & this man interprets the handwriting

(3, 4).clue: This brand gives you "that frosty mug sensation"

(4, 4).clue: This South Carolina site serves as the major east coast training base for the Marine Corps

(5, 4).clue: This "Tom Jones" author also wrote "Jonathan Wild", about a real-life thief & extortionist hanged in 1725

(6, 4).clue: In 1909 Wisconsin chose the wood species of this as its state flower

(1, 5).clue: Chapter 6 of his book concerns his deep anguish; in chapter 10, he questions his oppression

(3, 5).clue: The Dorsa brothers borrowed $35 to buy a waffle iron & this frozen brand was born

(4, 5).clue: Ownership of the Kuril islands has been in dispute between Russia & this country

(5, 5).clue: Fritz Haarmann was sort of the Jeffrey Dahmer of the chaotic post-WWI era in Germany named for this republic

(6, 5).clue: While in his mother's sitting room, this play character stabs & kills an old man through a curtain

(1, 1).clue: E.B. White began this novel about a "mouse" for his 6-year-old niece; she was grown & reading Hemingway by its finish

(2, 1).clue: (Drew Barrymore delivers the clue.) "I Want To Hold Your Hand" when I hear the song of that name written by this famous pair

(3, 1).clue: At No. 18, she's the only senator on the list

(4, 1).clue: Into the 20th Century it was thought the universe was one big galaxy--this one

(5, 1).clue: 1882:This influential writer & master of the English language is born in a Dublin suburb

(6, 1).clue: This state is powered by one "AMP"

(1, 2).clue: "If it were I who was to be always young, and the picture that was to grow old", this title guy "would give my soul"

(2, 2).clue: (Drew Barrymore delivers the clue) "The Sound Of Music" just wouldn't be the same without the sound of this Broadway duo's music & lyrics

(3, 2).clue: Do an MSN search & you'll find that this foundation co-founder & director is No. 12

(4, 2).clue: (Jon of the Clue Crew enlightens us with his scientific knowledge) It's a term for a machine that converts mechanical energy into electrical energy.  We've turned a motor into one by making it light up the bulb

(5, 2).clue: 1940:This legendary singer debuts with the Tommy Dorsey Orchestra

(6, 2).clue: Have some "GIN" in the middle of these two states

(1, 3).clue: A line from this book says, "She killed Miles.  And I've got... a black statuette that all that hell was about"

(2, 3).clue: (Drew Barrymore delivers the clue) "Do You Know The Way To San Jose?"  Then you'll know that Hal David wrote the lyrics, but this composer wrote the music

(3, 3).clue: On my honor, this Supreme Court Justice is No. 32

(4, 3).clue: Vauquelin found Beryllium in 1798, the year after he found this, symbol Cr

(5, 3).clue: 1653:This city, later renamed New York City, is incorporated

(6, 3).clue: It's a good place to get a "TAN" (Okay, not really)

(1, 4).clue: Chapter 8 of this 1860s novel is "Jo Meets Apollyon"

(2, 4).clue: (Drew Barrymore delivers the clue) "Jailhouse Rock" & "Love Potion No. 9" are just 2 of the rock & roll classics by Jerry Leiber & this partner

(3, 4).clue: We're happy to report that this Chief International Correspondent for CNN made the list at No. 79

(4, 4).clue: (Jimmy is in his Jeopardy! lab coat delivering the clue this time) You can take a simple nail, coil wire around it, connect it to a battery, and turn it into this attractive 13-letter item

(5, 4).clue: 1848:The Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo is signed, ending this war

(1, 5).clue: Dean says, "Think of it, Sal.  I've never been to Chicago in all my life, never stopped" in this 1957 classic

(2, 5).clue: (Drew Barrymore delivers the clue.) "For The Good Times", hits by this legend from Brownsville, Texas "Help Me Make It Through The Night"

(3, 5).clue: According to Forbes, the most powerful woman in the world is this German Chancellor

(4, 5).clue: Predicted in 1928, the first known antiparticle was the anti-this, also called the positron

(5, 5).clue: 1971:This man begins a 7-year reign as dictator of Uganda

(6, 5).clue: Should I wear a "BRA" there?  I think not

(0, 0).clue: In part, using donated French tanks, he formed the U.S. Army's first tank training school in 1917
